definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: We will expand the pilot program for renovating dilapidated houses in rural areas.
sentences.chinese: 擴大農村危房改造試點範圍。

sentences.english: We accelerated the renovation of dilapidated primary and secondary school buildings in rural areas and the development of vocational education infrastructure.
sentences.chinese: 加快農村中小學危房改造和職業教育基礎設施建設。

sentences.english: Sichuan Province armed police officers work yesterday to dismantle endangered houses in Panzhihua City.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，四川省武裝部隊官兵在攀枝花市拆除該市危房。

definition: a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
Pingfang district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to demolish a building and relocate the inhabitants
subsistence allowance/welfare (abbr. for 城市居民最低生活保障[cheng2 shi4 ju1 min2 zui4 di1 sheng1 huo2 bao3 zhang4])
abbr. for 違章建築|违章建筑, illegal construction
